learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a critical and in-depth understanding of key topics in an area of psychology.
Demonstrate an ability to communicate orally and in writing about a topic in an area of psychology.
Demonstrate an understanding of how different types of research methods can contribute to our understanding of an area of psychology.
Effectively engage with others to discuss and evaluate empirical research.

assessments.assessment_title: Infographic: Synthesis of a psychological topic
assessments.task_description: Each student is required to produce an infographic based on the same paper that you present in class. The infographic should communicate the core ideas, findings, and contribution of the paper in a clear and visually engaging way, suitable for a non-specialist audience. The aim of the infographic is not to reproduce the paper in full, but to distil its key arguments and evidence and present them in a concise, accessible format.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Infographic will be submitted to the Turnitin link on the course Blackboard Page
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Due the week you are assigned in the first two weeks of class
assessments.task_description: Every week, two or three students will present one paper each to the class. Each presentation should be around 25 minutes, with an additional 15 minutes for questions and discussion. Each student will present one paper during the semester. These papers have been chosen because they are interesting and can advance our thinking about a particular topic. The goal of the presentation is to provide an overview and analysis of the assigned paper, and to stimulate class discussion.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Students are expected to attend all presentations and come prepared to discuss the topic at hand. You are expected to actively contribute to the discussions, ask the speaker constructive and considered questions, demonstrate in your comments and questions that you clearly understand the topics that we’ve discussed. To be able to participate in this way it is necessary to adequately prepare for each session.

Questions from your assigned reading need to be emailed through to the course coordinator by 5pm on the day before the class. Questions received after 10am will not be accepted to count towards your preparation mark.
